posts.post_content: Wow: this is really bad. Not only is it only life gain, it is life gain that is contingent upon an action that isn't performed by the card itself. Wizards stated that they were pushing the power of life gain in this block due to the presence of Infect, yet this seems like it's sprinting in the opposite direction of that intention.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Woah that sucks...  
When do you need lifegain most?  
When your opponent is pummeling you and having destroyed your stuff.  
If your stuff is destroyed and your opponent keeps attacking you, will you be sure you can trigger this card? And if you do, will the 6 life save your butt?  
Not to mention that the artifact you put this on can still be bounced, exiled, returned to hand, stolen, pacified and so on, and this aura won't trigger.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I really wish it had flash, so that you could salvage an artifact that was already going to be destroyed.  
  
I did see a useful application for this, though. It was against some weird janky deck that involved blowing up your own artifacts to deal damage. This card by itself stalled the game for two turns. I'm sad to say that that's the best it will ever do, though...
